content.text:
# Draft:Second battle at Tver

| result      = Swedish-Russian victory
| combatants_header =
| combatant1  =  Tsardom of Russia Sweden
| combatant2  =  Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth
}}The Second Battle of Tver (the city was known as Kalinin from 1931 to 1990) was a significant conflict during the "Time of Troubles" in Russia. It took place on July 15, 1609, two days after a previous battle that had no decisive outcome. The battle resulted in a joint Swedish-Russian victory over the Polish-Lithuanian forces. However, despite this victory, the Swedish forces were unable to capture the city following the battle.
